U02FUQ9P22V.notes:
The great rain animals returned
this season, cascading
over our flimsy dam wall
and willing this old river
back into the ocean,
washing clean away
the great sand bar that has, 
for so long, separated them.

The cattle egrets step back
into soft Cintsa mud
celebrating the touch of sun
so dimly remembered after endless
cycles of silt and sadness.

Sing my heart, this beauty
has already saved the world
and will again, over and over:
life is the healing
for which we are here.
